org.esupportail.commons.services.exceptionHandling
Class CachingEmailExceptionServiceImpl

java.lang.Object
  org.esupportail.commons.beans.AbstractI18nAwareBean
      org.esupportail.commons.beans.AbstractApplicationAwareBean
          org.esupportail.commons.services.exceptionHandling.SimpleExceptionServiceImpl
              org.esupportail.commons.services.exceptionHandling.EmailExceptionServiceImpl
                  org.esupportail.commons.services.exceptionHandling.CachingEmailExceptionServiceImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, ExceptionService, org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean
public class CachingEmailExceptionServiceImpl
extends EmailExceptionServiceImpl

An implementation of ExceptionService, that logs the exceptions, send them to an email address and redirect to an exception page. The difference with EmailExceptionServiceImpl is that exceptions are cached (to prevent from to several emails for the same exception). See /properties/exceptionHandling/exceptionHandling-example.xml.

See Also:

sendEmail

protected void sendEmail(boolean intercept,
                         java.lang.Throwable t,
                         javax.mail.internet.InternetAddress to,
                         java.lang.String emailSubject,
                         java.lang.String htmlReport,
                         java.lang.String textReport)
Description copied from class: EmailExceptionServiceImpl
Send an exception report. This method has been added to allow it to be overriden (see org.esupportail.commons.services.exceptionHandling.CachingEmailExceptionServiceImpl).

Overrides:
sendEmail in class EmailExceptionServiceImpl
to - the recipient
emailSubject - the subject of the mail
htmlReport - the HTML body
textReport - the plain text body
See Also:
